calculator.title: Rent vs Buy
calculator.about: Free version of the New York Times calculator.

taxes.title: Taxes
taxes.taxCutsQuestion: Assume the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act will:

tooltips.homePrice: The current market price of the home you want to buy. This is the listing price or expected purchase price.
tooltips.monthlyRent: The monthly rent you would pay for a similar property in the same area.
tooltips.mortgageRate: The annual interest rate on your mortgage. This rate determines your monthly payments.
tooltips.downPayment: The percentage of the home price you'll pay upfront. A larger down payment means lower monthly payments and possibly no PMI.
tooltips.yearsToStay: How long you plan to live in the home. This affects whether buying makes financial sense compared to renting.
tooltips.mortgageLength: The total length of your mortgage, typically 15 or 30 years. Longer terms mean lower monthly payments but more interest paid.
tooltips.pmi: Private Mortgage Insurance rate, required if your down payment is less than 20%. This protects the lender if you default.
tooltips.homePriceGrowth: Expected annual increase in home values in your area. Historical average is around 3-4%.
tooltips.rentGrowth: Expected annual increase in rental prices. This varies by location but typically follows inflation.
tooltips.investmentReturn: Expected annual return on investments. This is used to calculate opportunity costs of your down payment.
tooltips.inflationRate: Expected annual rate of inflation. This affects the real value of your costs and gains over time.
tooltips.propertyTaxRate: Annual property tax as a percentage of your home's value. This varies significantly by location.
tooltips.marginalTaxRate: Your highest tax bracket percentage. This affects the tax benefits of homeownership.
tooltips.otherDeductions: Other tax deductions you plan to claim, such as charitable contributions or state taxes.
tooltips.buyingCosts: One-time costs when buying, including inspection, appraisal, and other closing costs.
tooltips.sellingCosts: Future costs of selling, including real estate agent commission (typically 5-6%) and other fees.
tooltips.maintenanceRate: Annual cost of maintaining your home, typically 1-4% of home value per year.
tooltips.insurance: Annual cost of homeowner's insurance as a percentage of home value.
tooltips.extraPayments: Additional monthly costs like HOA fees or extra mortgage payments.
tooltips.securityDeposit: Initial deposit required by landlord, typically 1-2 months' rent.
tooltips.brokerFee: One-time fee paid to rental broker, common in some cities.
tooltips.monthlyRentersInsurance: Monthly cost to insure your belongings as a renter.
